meanings.definition: To constantly criticize or dominate a person, especially a spouse, in a nagging or petty way.
meanings.sent1: She was always henpecking her husband about small things like leaving the toilet seat up.
meanings.sent2: Stop henpecking me about the dishes; I'll do them when I have time.
meanings.sent3: The little bird was henpecking its siblings for the best spot on the branch.
meanings.sent4: The boss henpecked his employees, never satisfied with their work.
meanings.sent5: The teacher henpecked the students for not completing their homework on time.

meanings.definition: The act of constantly criticizing or dominating a person, especially a spouse, in a nagging or petty way.
meanings.sent1: Living with constant henpecking can be exhausting and demoralizing.
meanings.sent2: Her constant henpecking of her husband led to tension in their marriage.
meanings.sent3: The henpecking of the team captain by the coach became a running joke among the players.
meanings.sent4: The henpecking of the employees by the manager created a toxic work environment.
meanings.sent5: The henpecking of the students by the principal only served to discourage them from learning.
